sentence.Network_en: Mary Ann's exhilaration gave way to gnawing fear.
sentence.Network_cn: 玛丽·安从欣喜若狂变得忧惧不安。

sentence.Network_en: The dog was gnawing a bone.
These doubts had been gnawing at him for some time.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些疑虑已经折磨他一段时间了.

list.abs: while the dog gnaws bone , companions would be none .狗啃骨头无同伴。
waves gnawed the sandy beach .海浪侵蚀沙滩.
gnaw into 啃gnaw off 咬掉gnaw 咬
her mistake gnawed at her conscience ., 她的错误折磨着自己的良心.

entry.def: If people or animals gnaw something or gnaw at it, they bite it repeatedly.

example.ex: Woodlice attack living plants and gnaw at the stems...
example.tran: 木虱会侵害活体植物并啃咬它们的茎。

example.ex: Melanie gnawed a long, painted fingernail.
example.tran: 梅拉妮咬着涂过指甲油的长指甲。

entry.def: If a feeling or thought gnaws at you, it causes you to keep worrying.

example.ex: Doubts were already gnawing away at the back of his mind...
example.tran: 心底的疑团已经开始困扰他。

example.ex: Mary Ann's exhilaration gave way to gnawing fear.
example.tran: 玛丽·安从欣喜若狂变得忧惧不安。

auth_sentence.content: Dribbling and gnawing is also a common complaint.

auth_sentence.content: I would sit in the morning, gnawing on my sugary breakfast cereal, just thinking.
auth_sentence.res_content: I would sit in the morning, gnawing on my sugary breakfast cereal, just thinking.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I would sit in the morning, gnawing on my sugary breakfast cereal, just thinking.

sentences.en: He was afflicted always with a gnawing restlessness.
sentences.cn: 他老是被一种叫人苦恼的不安情绪折磨着。
